column5: We have been fishing the gouin for 10 years and mostly stuck to jig/double tail/worm which has worked great. I tie the jig directly onto 12 lb florocarbon. I get a few lost fish when a pike hits it, but not too many. We are not going away from this type of fishing, just trying something new. My question is: When we try the jig n rap should we still tie directly on? should I use a snap swivel? Should I use a steel leader? Should I go to braid with a floro leader? Any thoughts would be great.
I would use a braid then a barrel swivel then a two to three feet of fluor 10 lb then the rap directly.
That what we do ice fishing for eye's.
Check out June issue of In Fisherman page 34Good Luck<*((()))<>

I don't use braided line jigging anymore but with a jigging rap I would go with 12-20lb braid with a 30-50lb florocarbon leader. Can't see where a 10lb leader would be better than just using 12lb the whole way. It's all floro. What's the braid going to help the pikes bitting it down by the jig.

I have used jigging raps some on LOTW, and I use a cross lock swivel to attach the rap to 10 lb power pro. I have not had any bite offs from pike that I can recall, but I don't use them all that often. I have had some success catching nice perch on LOTW with jigging raps.
